intro: Martiusia rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-stained martiusia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Martiusia rubiginosa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
